ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! He will be flung into the Shatterer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: By no means. He will be thrown into Hutama.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Nay, he shall be thrown into the Crusher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: By no means! They will be thrown into hutamah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Never! He will certainly be thrown into the Crushing One.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But no! Verily, he will be thrown into Al-Hutamah.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! he shall most certainly be hurled into the crushing disaster,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No indeed; he shall be thrust into the Crusher;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but verily he will be flung to the Consuming One.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By no means! He shall surely be cast into the crushing torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! He shall surely be cast into the Crushing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! He will surely be cast into the Crusher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into That which Breaks to Pieces,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! Verily, he will be thrown into the crushing Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On the contrary! He shall be flung to the Crusher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By no means. He will be thrown into the Crusher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [104:4] Nay! — a repudiation — He will surely be flung (la-yunbadhanna is the response to an omitted oath), that is, he will be hurled down, into the Crusher, that crushes everything that is thrown into it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay) this is a reply to him: it will not render him immortal in the life of the world, (but verily he will be flung to the Consuming One.
